articles.author: Saurabh Sharma, Tariq Maqbool, Aftab Ahmed
articles.description: A fragile ceasefire was holding between India and Pakistan on Sunday, after hours of overnight fighting between the nuclear-armed neighbours, as U.S. President Donald Trump said he will work to provide a solution regarding Kashmir.
articles.title: Fragile ceasefire holds between India, Pakistan as Trump offers more help

articles.author: Parisa Hafezi
articles.description: Top Iranian and U.S. negotiators will resume talks on Sunday to address disputes over Tehran's nuclear programme, in a push for progress as Washington hardens its stance ahead of U.S. President Donald Trump's Middle East visit.
articles.title: Iran, US to resume nuclear talks amid clashing red lines

articles.author: Marina Bobrova, Dmitry Antonov, Lidia Kelly
articles.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Sunday proposed direct talks with Ukraine on May 15 in Istanbul that he said should be aimed at achieving a durable peace and eliminating the root causes of the war.
articles.title: Putin proposes direct peace talks with Ukraine after three years of war

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: China's vice premier He Lipeng held talks with U.S. Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent early on Saturday in Geneva, China's state-owned news agency Xinhua reported.
articles.title: China-US trade talks begin in Geneva

articles.author: Elizabeth Piper, Andreas Rinke
articles.description: Ukraine and European leaders agreed on Saturday to an unconditional 30-day ceasefire on May 12 with the backing of U.S. President Donald Trump, threatening President Vladimir Putin with new "massive" sanctions if he failed to comply.
articles.title: Europe leaders, in Kyiv, turn up pressure on Russia over ceasefire

articles.author: Fatos Bytyci, Edward Mcallister
articles.description: Albania holds parliamentary elections on Sunday in which prime minister Edi Rama is seeking an unprecedented fourth term in office after a campaign dominated by promises to join the European Union and accusations of widespread graft.
articles.title: Albania votes as PM Rama seeks fourth term

articles.author: Nate Raymond
articles.description: A Tufts University student from Turkey who was swept up in the campaign by President Donald Trump's administration to deport pro-Palestinian campus activists returned to Massachusetts on Saturday after spending more than six weeks in an immigration detention center in Louisiana.
articles.title: Tufts student returns to Massachusetts after release from immigration custody

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Colombia granted asylum to Panama's former President Ricardo Martinelli, Colombian authorities said on Saturday, and two sources close to the ex-president said that he had departed the Nicaraguan embassy in Panama City for Colombia.
articles.title: Panama's ex-president Martinelli departs for asylum in Colombia

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: South Korea's former prime minister and acting president Han Duck-soo ended a short, ill-fated attempt to win the conservative party's presidential nomination on Sunday after days of internecine disputes just days out from the election.
articles.title: South Korea's former PM Han drops presidential bid, ending rift among conservatives

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Bangladesh’s interim government has banned all activities of the Awami League, the political party of deposed former Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina, under the country’s Anti-Terrorism Act, citing national security concerns.
articles.title: Bangladesh bans activities of ousted PM Hasina’s party following protests
